greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A000045(n) - A113405(n).
comment: Because the inverse binomial transform of A000045 and A113405 is individually the same as the original sequence up to a sign flip of each second term, the same is true for their difference here. (The inverse binomial transform is a linear transform.)
The sequence and its higher order differences in subsequent rows has zeros on the main diagonal:
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (3,-1,-3,3,-1,-2).
results.author: _Paul Curtz_, Jun 21 2008
